scenario:
Celsius stock has struggled since last summer due to uncertainty related to one of its major distributors, likely PepsiCo, scaling back purchases amid slowing demand. Despite this, investors may have compelling reasons to buy the beverage stock. Celsius has differentiated itself in the energy drink industry by targeting health enthusiasts and partnering with PepsiCo, which increased its availability and brought huge sales growth. The company has announced plans to buy out Alani Nu, a peer that competes for the same pool of health-oriented customers, solidifying its lead in this part of the industry.

Celsius' revenue decline may soon end, with a 4% yearly decline in Q4 2024 compared to a 31% decline in Q3. The company increased its points of distribution by 37% in 2024 and introduced a new product category, Celsius Hydration, indicating a rightsizing of inventories could return it to growth in 2025. Analysts expect a 25% increase in yearly sales growth in 2025.

Celsius has a considerable opportunity to grow sales outside North America, with revenue in this segment growing by 39% yearly in Q4. This market expansion is still in its early stages, and success internationally would mean that its market expansion is still in its early stages.

Celsius stock is still a bargain, selling at a discount of more than 70% from its high in the summer of 2024. Its valuation metrics have become more attractive, with a price-to-sales ratio of 5 and a forward P/E ratio of 28, assuming a 25% revenue projection for 2025 holds.
